title: Magdrive Raises $10.5M to Advance Satellite Propulsion Systems
summary:
UK-based in-space propulsion company Magdrive has announced the closure of a $10.5 million (€9.99 million) seed round to advance its high-thrust electric propulsion technology. Founded in 2019, Magdrive is developing a range of high-thrust electric propulsion systems for satellites and spacecraft. The company is currently working toward an initial test flight of its Rouge thruster […]
The post Magdrive Raises $10.5M to Advance Satellite Propulsion Systems appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Former FCC Space Bureau chief joins law firm
summary:

title: Magdrive raises $10.5 million and opens U.S. office
summary:
Magdrive plans to build a U.K. manufacturing facility and conduct on-orbit tests of electric plasma thrusters.

title: NASA Prepares Gateway Lunar Space Station for Journey to Moon
summary: Assembly is underway for Gateway's Power and Propulsion Element, the module that will power the lunar space station's journey to and around the Moon as part of NASA’s Artemis campaign.

title: NASA: New Study on Why Mars is Red Supports Potentially Habitable Past
summary: A new international study partially funded by NASA on how Mars got its iconic red color adds to evidence that Mars had a cool but wet and potentially habitable climate in its ancient past. The current atmosphere of Mars is too cold and thin to support liquid water, an essential ingredient for life, on its […]

title: Have we been wrong about why Mars is red?
summary: The Red Planet’s iconic rusty dust has a much wetter history than previously assumed, find scientists combining European Space Agency (ESA) and NASA spacecraft data with new laboratory experiments on replica Mars dust. The results suggest that Mars rusted early in the planet’s ancient past, when liquid water was more widespread.

title: Asteroid 2024 YR4 no longer poses significant impact risk
summary: The latest analysis from the European Space Agency (ESA) Planetary Defence Office has reduced the probability that asteroid 2024 YR4 might impact Earth in 2032 to 0.001%.
